title: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah unveils Ambedkar statue
content: Siddaramaiah was speaking after unveiling a 14-feet-high bronze statue of B.R Ambedkar at Yelahanka in Bengaluru

title: Dalit seers seek funds for mutts; meets CM Siddaramaiah
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah assured the seers that funds would be allocated to mutts in the coming days

title: Waqf Act: AIMPLB questions correctness of Centre's affidavit in SC
content: The board has expressed serious objections to the statement made by the government that there has been a "shocking increase" in the number of Waqf properties uploaded in the central portal after 2013

title: Sahitya Akademi invites entries for translation prize
content: The annual award honours outstanding translations of literary works into the 24 Indian languages recognised by the akademi

title: Pahalgam terror attack LIVE: Modi doubles down on commitment to take ‘firm and decisive’ action against perpetrators
content: PM’s comments come amidst calls for de-escalation, Lavrov, EU FM Kallas speak to Jaishankar, Modi meets Angola President

title: Perseverance is key to success, Union Minister tells women entrepreneurs
content: Pemmasani Chandrasekhar inaugurates ADITRI, a rural entrepreneurship initiative, at SRM University-AP

title: India abruptly recalls IMF Executive Director K. V. Subramanian 6 months ahead of tenure
content: According to the sources, Mr. Subramanian is learnt to have raised questions about the IMF's datasets, which did not go down well in the corridors of the multilateral agency

title: Over 72,000 candidates to take NEET (UG)-2025 in Telangana today
content: In all, 72,507 candidates have registered for the test in Telangana, and it will be conducted from 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. in 190 examination centres across the State

title: New Delhi's plan to ask IMF to review Pak. loans is politically motivated: Islamabad
content: The IMF Executive Board is scheduled to meet Pakistan officials on May 9 for the first review of the Extended Funding Facility

title: ICAR to launch two genome edited rice varieties
content: The ICAR says development of such seeds is ‘first-ever such achievement’ in the country using cutting-edge genome editing technology

title: Pakistani Ranger apprehended by BSF from international border in Rajasthan
content: The development comes nearly a fortnight after a BSF jawan was apprehended by the Rangers amid rising tension between the two countries in the wake of the terrorist attack in Pahalgam

title: What are the key objectives of caste count?
content: Why is the BJP government’s decision a surprise? What are the challenges the exercise will throw up? What are the complexities? What will it mean for the reservation ceiling? Which are the States that have already conducted a caste enumeration?

title: Governor is mere rubber stamp post: Stalin
content: Speaking at an event held in Chennai, he says the State government not only provides land and financial resources to set up universities and colleges but also gives salaries to staff and provides amenities to students; he questions the reasoning behind letting the Governor nominate Vice-Chancellors

title: Distress in the salt pans
content: The vibrant salt manufacturing industry of Tamil Nadu, where nine coastal districts produce salt, finds itself in the doldrums, thanks to a variety of factors. In this deep dive, Deepa H. Ramakrishnan finds out what ails the industry and how these issues can be resolved

title: At The Huddle, players from three generations to take the field for women’s cricket in India
content: At The Hindu Huddle session titled ‘No Boundaries: Growth of women’s cricket in India’, Shanta Rangaswamy, India’s first women’s team captain and a former BCCI apex council member; Mithali Raj, former India captain; and Shreyanka Patil, India international and Royal Challengers Bengaluru cricketer, will talk us through the journey of women’s cricket

title: Two Americans detained at Mizoram airport, sent back to Delhi
content: The American citizens worked with a number of non-government organisations in Bangladesh’s Chittagong area, raising suspicions about the purpose of their visit to Mizoram, says an official

title: Modi doubles down on commitment to take ‘firm and decisive’ action against Pahalgam perpetrators
content: PM’s comments come amidst calls for de-escalation, Lavrov, EU FM Kallas speak to Jaishankar, Modi meets Angola President

title: Groundwater exploitation in rural Bengaluru threat to drinking water systems: Study
content: The research report identifies that the problem is largely driven by the free supply of electricity to farmers for irrigation borewells

title: Indian Bank Q4 profit soars 32% to ₹2,956 crore helped by improvement in core income
content: During the quarter, the bank's total income increased to ₹18,599 crore from ₹16,887 crore a year ago, Indian Bank said in a regulatory filing.

title: In a historic first, Kolkata Port launches night navigation for round-the-clock vessel movement
content: This development is expected to enable more vessels to enter and leave the port daily, therefore increasing efficiency and overall trade activities handled by the port.

title: CRPF constable dismissed from service for ‘concealing marriage’ to Pakistani woman
content: ‘His actions were found to be in violation of service conduct and detrimental to national security,’ the CRPF said

title: U.K. and India can be exemplars of how you can use culture to bring people closer together: U.K. Culture Secretary
content: During a three-day visit to India, U.K. Culture Secretary Lisa Nandy emphasised the significance of a newly signed bilateral Cultural Cooperation Agreement designed to foster deeper ties between British and Indian creative sectors and museums

title: Tripura signs MoU with the IIM to provide advanced training to Panchayat officials
content: The signing took place during National Panchayat Day celebrations on Saturday; on the occasion, the Chief Minister acknowledged efforts of Panchayats in delivering effective rural governance recognised through national awards

title: Children of Kurukkankundu in Agali seek Collector’s help for road, power
content: They say basic facilities are being denied to them because of the objections raised by the Forest department

title: Social activist Mano Bakthavatsalam passes away at 95
content: She was a committee member of the Bharatiya Vidya Bhavan, was honorary secretary of the Women’s Voluntary Service of Tamil Nadu

title: AIADMK-BJP alliance has left Stalin frustrated: Edappadi K. Palaniswami
content: Speaking at a public meeting in Chennai’s T. Nagar, he alleged that the DMK has no principles or ideology and only seeks power, focusing on dynastic and family politics

title: Kharge objects to confining Ambedkar’s legacy only to Dalits
content: Mallikarjun Kharge presents a handwritten letter by Ambedkar to counter BJP’s repeated allegations that Congress was responsible his defeat in the 1952 general elections

title: Congress demands BJP MLA’s disqualification after High Court upholds his conviction
content: A sessions court in Aklera had convicted Kanwar Lal Meena in December 2020 after finding him guilty of obstructing government work, intimidating government officials, and vandalising property

title: Multiple-level probes into fire outbreak at Kozhikode MCH
content: Preliminary post-mortem report rules out possibility of inhalation of smoke as the cause of death of five patients on ventilator support

title: All arrangements in place for Pooram, says Minister Vasavan
content: Safety checks completed on all Corporation buildings, and dangerous overhanging tree branches removed. No communal, political, or provocative symbols, slogans, or flags should be used as part of the festival

title: Bengaluru’s restaurants see self-delivery systems as alternative to aggregators
content: While the issue of commission is a huge burden that restaurants are not able to cope with when it comes to the apps which have a duopoly in the market, in the case of ONDC, there are logistical issues concerning last mile-connectivity

title: Twin brothers top district in Odisha Class X exam with identical scores
content: The brothers scored 560 out of 600 marks in this year’s matriculation examination, results of which were announced by the Board of Secondary Education (BSE), Odisha on May 2

title: Pahalgam terrorist attack: Terrorists mingled with crowd, herded them towards armed members who killed toursists at Baisaran
content: As the gunshots rang out at Pahalgam on April 22, two terrorists who had earlier mingled with the tourists, deliberately guided the people towards two other armed assailants to prevent the crowd from scattering, say officials; the terrorists had fled into forests before the reinforcements arrived

title: Manipur marks two years of ethnic violence by remembering victims
content: The Meitei-majority Imphal Valley and the hills dominated by the Kuki-Zo people shut down on the second anniversary of the conflict that claimed more than 250 lives

title: Day after, Amaravati Pylon draws visitors with high hopes on a bright future for State
content: Among the crowd are many farmers who gave their land for the capital and are in a jubilant mood following the Friday’s relaunch of the much delayed works; they express the hope and belief that the State Govt. will be able to complete the works as promised ushering in a new era of development

title: FIR against singer Sonu Nigam for ‘insulting’ people of Karnataka
content: One of the fans requested him to sing a Kannada song to which he took offence, and retorted that this was the attitude that resulted in the Pahalgam attack

title: Consider Constitutional options to prevent spillover of Murshidabad violence: WB Governor report to Centre
content: Governor C.V. Ananda Bose recommends “overarching legislation” to empower Centre when State fails, a Commission of Inquiry, and setting up of outposts of central forces in vulnerable districts

title: Project to renovate Chinese fishing nets on Fort Kochi beach in limbo
content: Only four of the 11 nets renovated.  The ₹2.40-crore project of Kerala Tourism was launched almost a decade ago. Owners express concern at the delay in sanctioning funds, including to procure fishing nets for the project

title: President, CJI stress on mediation to resolve conflicts, lower the burden on courts
content: They say mediation can enhance both the ease of doing business and the ease of living and the same is not a lesser form of justice, but a wiser form of it

title: Photography expo celebrates biodiversity of kole fields
content: Over 240 photographs taken by around 100 birdwatchers offer visitors a vivid insight into the unique ecosystem

title: Anti-communal task force will be formed to tackle communal crimes: Karnataka Home Minister Parameshwara
content: To be formed on the lines of the Anti-Naxal Force and headed by an officer of the rank of IGP, it will handle such crimes, including hate speeches, in Dakshina Kannada and Udupi districts, says Home Minister

title: Sample fireworks set to light up Thrissur skies on Sunday
content: Thiruvambady and Paramekkavu Devaswoms have come up with themes inspired by blockbuster movie titles such as ‘Marco,’ ‘Bazooka,’ and ‘Empuran.’

title: Butts to blame: Careless smoking tops fire causes in Telangana
content: Careless smoking caused 3,865 fires in Telangana in 2024, topping the list of triggers, with homes, warehouses and commercial spaces worst affected

title: It is anti-Hindu task force to oppress Hindutva activists, says BJP
content: The party says Speaker U.T. Khader’s true colours revealed after the arrest of 2022 murder victim Fazil’s brother Adil Mehroof in Suhas Shetty murder case

title: Nuggets crush Clippers in decisive Game 7
content: The Nuggets, with a Game 7 loss at home last season to the Timberwolves fresh in their memories, blew out the Clippers in the second half to clinch the series.

title: Sovereignty outduels Journalism to capture Derby
content: Sovereignty outdueled Journalism down the stretch on a muddy track to capture the 151st Kentucky Derby on Saturday at Churchill Downs.

title: Twins' Clemens homers at Fenway in front of dad
content: Kody Clemens, the son of former Red Sox pitcher Roger Clemens, homered into the right-field seats in the sixth inning during his first game at Fenway Park.

title: Fan who fell at PNC Park awake, shows 'progress'
content: Kavan Markwood, the 20-year-old who slipped off a railing during the seventh inning of the Pittsburgh Pirates' 4-3 win over the Chicago Cubs on Wednesday night, is awake and alert, according to Jennifer Phillips, who has organized a fundraiser for him.

title: Dent, pioneering Black golfer, dies at age 85
content: Jim Dent, one of the top Black golfers on PGA Tour Champions and known for his long hitting off the tee, died at the age of 85.

title: Scheffler's 54-hole lead largest on tour since '11
content: Scottie Scheffler's lead at the CJ Cup Byron Nelson is 8 shots as he stands at 23 under entering the final round Sunday.

title: Canes' Andersen, 35, secures deal before Round 2
content: On Saturday, the Carolina Hurricanes, who will meet the Washington Capitals in the East's second round next week, signed goaltender Frederik Andersen to a one-year contract for next season, a pact worth $2.75 million for the 35-year-old veteran.

title: Which Braves are the REAL Braves?
content: No team has made the playoffs after starting 0-7, but Atlanta has played better since. Will that continue -- and will it be enough?

title: Handing out April grades for all 30 MLB teams
content: Is your favorite team acing -- or flunking -- the early part of the 2025 season? We break it all down.

title: Neither parenthood nor McLaren can slow Verstappen in Miami
content: There's a myth in racing that becoming a parent makes a racer slow down. Max Verstappen is proving that wrong.

title: What this monumental coaching change means for San Antonio
content: What's next for San Antonio after Pop's move to the front office? What does Mitch Johnson bring? Our NBA insiders break down the news.

title: Arsenal ratings: Gunners poor beyond Rice, Ødegaard in loss to Bournemouth
content: Arsenal made it three league games without a win as a poor second half swung things in Bournemouth's favor. The one plus: no injuries ahead of a pivotal Champions League semifinal, second leg, at PSG this Wednesday.

title: Jawan who 'secretly' married Pakistani woman via video call sacked
content: CRPF jawan Munir Ahmed was dismissed for concealing his marriage to Pakistani citizen Menal Khan and for her visa overstay. This action was deemed a violation of service conduct and a threat to national security. While Menal faced deportation following diplomatic tensions, the High Court intervened, temporarily halting her removal from India.

title: 'No welcome, till there is revenge': Minister refuses to accept bouquet at an event
content: Union Minister CR Patil, in a strong statement against terrorism, refused all welcoming gestures at a Gujarat event following the Pahalgam attack that killed 26. Patil declared he would not accept bouquets or mementos until the terrorists are brought to justice.

title: 'I take the blame': MS Dhoni takes responsibility of CSK's loss vs RCB
content: In a thrilling IPL match, Royal Challengers Bengaluru narrowly defeated Chennai Super Kings by two runs. CSK skipper MS Dhoni took responsibility for the loss, feeling he should have converted more shots to ease pressure. Despite impressive performances from Ayush Mhatre and Ravindra Jadeja, RCB's Romario Shepherd's explosive batting and Yash Dayal's final over secured the win.

title: Google CEO makes an ‘Apple announcement’ under oath, says Tim Cook was…
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai confirmed under oath that Gemini, its AI chatbot, is expected to be integrated into Siri by mid-2025. Discussions with Apple CEO Tim Cook included Gemini app distribution, with Cook indicating more third-party AI models would be incorporated into Apple Intelligence later in 2025. This partnership would significantly expand Gemini's reach across Apple devices.

title: Who is Greg Abel? Meet Warren Buffett’s successor
content: Warren Buffett surprised shareholders by announcing his intent to retire as Berkshire Hathaway CEO by year's end, naming Greg Abel as his successor. Abel, a 25-year Berkshire veteran currently overseeing non-insurance operations, will now lead the $865 billion conglomerate.

title: India abruptly removes IMF board nominee KV Subramanian 6 months before tenure end
content: The Indian government abruptly removed Krishnamurthy Subramanian from the IMF board, six months before his term ended, amidst disagreements over IMF datasets and allegations of impropriety related to his book promotion. This decision precedes a crucial IMF meeting regarding a $1.3 billion climate resilience loan to Pakistan, a move India opposes.

title: Warren Buffet says Apple under Cook has contributed to Berkshire more than ...
content: Warren Buffett lauded Tim Cook's leadership at Apple, acknowledging his significant contribution to Berkshire Hathaway's financial gains. Despite reducing Berkshire's Apple stake, Buffett emphasized Cook's unique ability to develop Apple, drawing a comparison to Steve Jobs. Since Cook became CEO in 2011, Apple's stock has surged, driving its market capitalization to over $3 trillion.

title: 'Alert mode': Long leaves cancelled at ordnance factories in Pahalgam aftermath
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack and heightened tensions with Pakistan, Munitions India Limited (MIL) has reportedly cancelled extended leaves for employees across most of its 12 ordnance factories. While senior management cites missed production targets and export orders as the reason, some officials suggest national security concerns prompted the decision.

title: Airtel-Tata DTH merger talks fail, Airtel informs BSE
content: Bharti Airtel and Tata Group have called off their discussions to merge Airtel Digital TV and Tata Play due to unresolved issues. The proposed deal, aimed at combining the two loss-making DTH operations, involved a share swap where Airtel would potentially hold a majority stake.

title: Lawrence Wong retains power in Singapore’s general election
content: Prime Minister Lawrence Wong led the People's Action Party (PAP) to a decisive victory in Singapore's General Election, securing 87 of 97 parliamentary seats. The election, Wong's first test as prime minister, occurred amidst economic uncertainties caused by US trade tariffs. Voters cast ballots for 92 contested seats, determining Singapore's political direction as the PAP continues its long-standing governance.

title: India rejects Pakistan's call for 'neutral' Pahalgam probe
content: India has firmly rejected Pakistan's proposal for a neutral probe into the Pahalgam killings, denouncing it as a deceptive tactic to divert attention from Pakistan's involvement. Indian officials assert that the call for neutrality is a ploy to evade accountability and undermine India's security interests.

title: Kohli skips team celebration amid Avneet Kaur row; netizens say trolls broke him
content: Despite Royal Challengers Bengaluru's thrilling victory over Chennai Super Kings, Virat Kohli's subdued demeanor sparked concern among fans. Following an Instagram controversy involving a liked post and actress Avneet Kaur, Kohli issued a clarification. However, his lack of celebration and solitary presence after the match fueled speculation, with fans expressing worry and support on social media.

title: The worst game in Premier League history? Southampton might just be the worst team
content: Leicester vs. Southampton came with such a low billing some fans had even dubbed it "El Crapico," a game between the two worst teams in the league.

title: Kane comes within 1 min of trophy as Bayern draw
content: RB Leipzig's Yussuf Poulsen scored a stoppage-time goal to snatch a 3-3 draw against Bundesliga leaders Bayern Munich on Saturday and delay the Bavarians' title celebrations by at least a day.

title: Bournemouth seal first-ever win at Arsenal
content: Bournemouth came from behind to win away at Arsenal for the first time in their history, with Evanilson's scrappy goal giving the Cherries a 2-1 victory.

title: Napoli win to move step closer to Serie A title
content: League leaders Napoli moved one step closer to winning the Serie A title with a 1-0 win at relegation-threatened Lecce on Saturday, taking the visitors provisionally six points clear of Scudetto rivals Inter Milan.

title: Leicester game delayed as ref suffers head injury
content: Leicester's clash with Southampton was held up for 11 minutes after referee David Webb was forced out of the game after being injured in a collision.

title: Firmino captains Al Ahli to 1st Asian CL title
content: Saudi Arabia's Al Ahli beat Japan's Kawasaki Frontale 2-0 to win the Asian Champions League Elite title for the first time at a raucous King Abdullah Sports City Stadium.

title: Source: USMNT's Ledezma mulling Chivas interest
content: USMNT's Richard Ledezma is weighing up his future at PSV Eindhoven amid interest from Chivas and other clubs in Mexico, a source told ESPN.

title: Source: Mckennie in talks over new Juve contract
content: Juventus are set to sit down with United States international Weston McKennie to discuss a new contract, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Bundesliga relegation clash hospitalizes 2 players
content: Heidenheim's Kevin Müller and Bochum's Philipp Hofmann were both recovering in hospitals after being injured in their teams' Bundesliga relegation scrap.

title: 12 reasons why Naoya Inoue defines must-see boxing
content: Timothy Bradley Jr. breaks down Inoue's game in 12 categories, from offense to defense and power and speed.

title: Canelo Alvarez-William Scull live updates, results and analysis
content: Canelo Alvarez takes on William Scull for the right to become undisputed super middleweight champion once again. Follow live.

title: Luck Index 2025: Who needs luck on their side next season?
content: Turnover luck, coordinator upgrade, transfer portal haul? They all could lead to some upswings for a select few teams.

title: 'We've got the identity that fits us': Wisconsin turns back the clock to move forward
content: Wisconsin coach Luke Fickell is going back to the Badgers' roots in a crucial Year 3 for his program.

title: Fatherhood, a decade in F1 give Verstappen perspective on what's important
content: Max Verstappen's role as a dad isn't the only reason for his increasingly elder-statesman status in F1.

title: How Wrexham paid their way to promotion, and why the Premier League requires more than that
content: Wrexham's promotion might look miraculous, but it's actually a combination of factors that other Premier League hopefuls shouldn't try to replicate.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Huijsen to pick Liverpool, Arsenal or Chelsea
content: Dean Huijsen's future could be decided this month with Chelsea, Arsenal and Liverpool all in the race. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Days before Pahalgam attack, intel hinted at terror plans to hit tourist sites
content: Intelligence chatter before the Pahalgam massacre indicated terror groups planned to target tourist spots in J&K, especially hotels near Srinagar. Despite generic warnings about potential attacks on tourists, laborers, and pilgrims in various areas, Baisaran lacked specific mention.

title: 'Our response was measured': Pakistani PM on India's 'provocative actions'
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, which resulted in 26 fatalities, including a Nepalese tourist, Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif asserted that Pakistan's reaction to India's alleged provocative actions was responsible and measured. He refuted India's accusations, offered assistance with an international investigation, and reiterated Pakistan's opposition to terrorism.

title: Near-total bandh, memorials mark 2 years of Manipur strife
content: Manipur marked two years since the eruption of ethnic violence between Meitei and Kuki-Zo groups, bringing life to a standstill across the Imphal Valley and Kuki-majority hill districts. The conflict has resulted in over 260 deaths, thousands injured, and the displacement of 70,000 people, deepening divisions and leaving many in camps facing trauma and economic hardship.

title: Saquon Barkley slammed as fiancée’s racist tweets resurface before WH visit
content: Saquon Barkley's high-profile golf outing with Donald Trump and flight on Air Force One sparked controversy ahead of the Eagles' White House visit. Simultaneously, old, offensive tweets from Barkley's fiancée, Anna Congdon, resurfaced, drawing criticism, especially given their biracial child. The events ignited debate about athletes' engagement with politics and the separation of personal gestures from public perception.

title: 'Raid 2' box office collection: Ajay Devgn starrer misses Rs 50 Crore mark in 3 days
content: Ajay Devgn's Raid 2, a sequel with high expectations, opened strongly but narrowly missed the Rs 50 crore mark in its first three days, collecting Rs 49.25 crore. Despite a good start and a Saturday surge driven by positive word-of-mouth, the film's growth was limited by a three-way box office clash.

title: US trade talks on, government seeks industry inputs
content: The Indian government is engaging with industry representatives regarding the proposed trade deal with the US, focusing on product-specific tariffs and rules of origin. Businesses are being prepared for potential reciprocal tariffs and are asked to identify non-tariff barriers. The US rules of origin, which emphasize changes in product form and character, differ from India's value addition approach.

title: US approves HawkEye 360 sale to boost India’s surveillance
content: The US State Department has approved the sale of HawkEye 360 technology to India, enhancing its maritime domain awareness in the Indo-Pacific. This system, utilizing satellites in Low Earth Orbit, will improve India's ability to detect illegal activities and monitor its Exclusive Economic Zone. The $131 million deal includes software, training, and support, bolstering India's strategic posture.

title: 'Will take firm & decisive action against terrorists': PM Modi on J&K attack
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi affirmed India's resolve to act decisively against the Pahalgam attackers and their supporters. This statement came amidst international calls for restraint. Modi and Angola President Joao Manuel Lourenco agreed that terrorism is a major threat. Lourenco condemned the attack and expressed solidarity. India announced a $200 million defence credit line for Angola.

title: Defence minister Rajnath Singh too set to skip Russia's V-Day parade
content: Amidst escalating tensions with Pakistan and ongoing exchanges of fire along the Line of Control, both Prime Minister Modi and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh will skip Russia's Victory Day parade in Moscow. Junior Defence Minister Sanjay Seth is expected to represent India at the May 9th celebrations.

title: Farooq Abdullah links Pahalgam attack to local support
content: Farooq Abdullah asserted that the Pahalgam terrorist attack, resulting in 26 fatalities, likely involved local support, sparking criticism from Mehbooba Mufti. Abdullah also reiterated his opposition to the Indus Waters Treaty, advocating for its review due to perceived harm to the region's interests.

title: Warren Buffett plans to retire by year’s end, recommends Greg Abel as successor
content: Warren Buffett announced his retirement from Berkshire Hathaway by year-end, naming Greg Abel as his successor. Despite a significant drop in first-quarter profits, attributed to investment valuation decreases and insurance losses, Buffett expressed confidence in Abel's leadership. He pledged to retain his Berkshire shares, emphasizing Abel's potential to enhance the company's performance.

title: No more mail, imports, ships from Pak: India slaps slew of bans amid rising tensions
content: Following the deadly terror attack in Pahalgam, India has imposed stringent measures against Pakistan, halting all imports and suspending mail services. Pakistani vessels are now barred from Indian ports, and Indian ships are prohibited from visiting Pakistani ports. These actions mark a significant escalation in response to identified cross-border linkages and aim to ensure national security.

title: Watch: Jadeja confronts umpire after Brevis denied DRS
content: Dewald Brevis's golden duck amidst DRS controversy marred CSK's narrow defeat against RCB in a thrilling IPL 2025 encounter. Brevis was adjudged LBW, but replays suggested the ball would have missed the stumps. The missed review proved costly as CSK fell short by two runs despite valiant efforts from Ayush Mhatre and Ravindra Jadeja.

title: IPL: Shepherd's carnage, Dayal's ice-cold finish take RCB to the top
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru secured a thrilling victory against Chennai Super Kings in a last-ball encounter. RCB's formidable total, powered by Kohli, Bethell, and Shepherd, was nearly chased down by CSK, with Mhatre's brilliant 94 and Jadeja's 77. Dayal's composed final over sealed the win for RCB, propelling them to the top of the points table.

title: Draft tiers at guard
content: Eric Moody goes through the different tiers at the guard position to help you in your 2025 fantasy women's basketball draft.

title: Hunter Brown leads all fantasy pitchers? Eugenio Suarez ends up a top-50 hitter? Don't be surprised
content: Eric Karabell looks into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

title: Move over Gayle! Shepherd now owns fastest fifty in RCB history
content: Romario Shepherd's explosive batting propelled Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a formidable total against CSK. He etched his name in IPL history by smashing a 14-ball fifty, equalling the second-fastest half-century record. Shepherd's onslaught included a 33-run over and a display of power-hitting in the death overs, showcasing his finishing prowess with a staggering strike rate.

title: CSA issues strong statement on Kagiso Rabada ban
content: South African cricket star Kagiso Rabada faces a provisional suspension after testing positive for a recreational drug, confirmed by both the player and Cricket South Africa (CSA). Rabada, who recently left the Indian Premier League citing personal reasons, expressed regret but affirmed his commitment to the sport.

title: Pak goods worth $500mn 'entering India' via other countries: Official
content: Amidst heightened tensions following a terrorist attack, India is reportedly considering a complete ban on direct and indirect trade with Pakistan. Concerns have arisen over $500 million worth of Pakistani goods, including dry fruits and chemicals, entering India via countries like the UAE and Sri Lanka.

title: ‘Unpredictable-irrational Donald’: Is Trump redrawing global rules to suit Putin?
content: A Bloomberg analysis suggests a concerning alignment between President Donald Trump's rhetoric and Putin's agenda, particularly on Nato and Ukraine. While CNN reports US intelligence warnings about Russian interference benefiting Trump, expert Prof. Pant cautions against simplistic interpretations, highlighting Trump's unpredictability and Putin's historical ambitions.

title: Virat Kohli turns CSK into his favourite punching bag - check the numbers
content: Virat Kohli's dominance in the IPL is highlighted by his consistent performance, especially against Chennai Super Kings. He holds the record for most runs against a single opponent in IPL history, with 1,146 runs against CSK. Kohli also has the most fifty-plus scores against CSK, totaling 10. Kohli has now recorded four consecutive fifty-plus scores, equaling his own RCB record set nine years ago.

title: SC likely to hear plea on May 5 over Nishikant Dubey’s remarks against CJI
content: The Supreme Court is set to hear a plea on May 5 regarding BJP MP Nishikant Dubey's alleged derogatory remarks against the court and CJI. The petition seeks suo motu contempt proceedings, citing an attack on judicial dignity. Dubey criticized the Supreme Court's handling of the Waqf (Amendment) Act, claiming the court was overstepping its bounds and provoking religious discord.

title: 'Debate over Kohli's strike-rate and intent should stop now'
content: Virat Kohli silenced critics with a blistering 62 off 33 balls against Chennai Super Kings, reaffirming his status as an IPL legend. He achieved the milestone of hitting 300 sixes for RCB and reclaimed the Orange Cap with 505 runs this season, marking his eighth 500+ run season, surpassing David Warner.

title: 'Detrimental to ...': CRPF jawan sacked for hiding marriage to Pak woman
content: CRPF jawan Munir Ahmed has been dismissed for concealing his marriage to a Pakistani national, a move considered a threat to national security. Ahmed, serving with the 41st battalion, was terminated without inquiry after it was discovered he married Menal Khan via video call and failed to report her visa overstay.

title: Who Is Greg Abel, Executive Picked To Be Warren Buffett's Successor
content: When Warren Buffett announced at his annual shareholder meeting Saturday that he is stepping down as CEO of Berkshire Hathaway at the end of the year, he elevated a low-key 62-year-old Canadian executive named Greg Abel.

title: Massive Russian Drone Attack On Kyiv Sets Several Buildings On Fire
content: Russia's overnight drone attack on Kyiv damaged several residential buildings and set cars on fire throughout the city, the military and officials of the Ukrainian capital said on Sunday.

title: Pak Ranger Detained By India, LoC Sees Night Of Biggest Ceasefire Violation
content: The Border Security Force (BSF) has taken into custody a Pakistani Ranger from along the international border in Rajasthan on Saturday.

title: Warren Buffett's Best And Worst Investments In Last 60 Years
content: Billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Saturday that he wants to step down as chief executive of Berkshire Hathaway at the end of the year. The revelation came as a surprise because the 94-year-old had previously said he did not plan to retire.

title: RBI Fines ICICI, Axis, 3 Other Key Banks Over Lack Of Regulatory Compliances
content: A penalty of Rs 31.80 lakh was imposed on Bank of Maharashtra for non-compliance with certain directions on KYC.

title: "Won't Bet On A Currency Going To Hell": Warren Buffett's Dollar Warning
content: The world's most revered investor, Warren Buffett, who has run Berkshire Hathaway for over 60 years, has shared his insights on global affairs and trade at his company's annual gathering, which has long been known as the "Woodstock for Capitalists".

title: Warren Buffett To Step Down, Greg Abel To Be New Berkshire Hathaway CEO
content: Warren Buffett, who built Berkshire Hathaway into a business valued at over $1.16 trillion and himself into a celebrity billionaire renowned for his investing acumen and witticisms, will step down at year-end after six decades atop the conglomerate.

title: After New Delhi's Strong Move, Pakistan Shuts Ports For Indian Ships
content: India on Saturday imposed a ban on the import of goods coming from or transiting through Pakistan and also the entry of Pakistani ships into its ports.

title: Man Breaks Into Pak Woman Seema Haider's Home, Claims She Did 'Black Magic'
content: Seema Haider, who hails from Jacobabad in Pakistan's Sindh province, took her children and left home in Karachi in May 2023 to travel to India via Nepal.

title: Pilot Dead, Houses Damaged As Small Plane Crashes In California
content: About 40 firefighters were on scene. With the flames out, they began working on overhaul and salvage operations.

title: Lawrence Wong's Party Secures Landslide Victory In Singapore General Election
content: Prime Minister Lawrence Wong's People's Action Party (PAP) won the Singapore General Election Saturday by a landslide, securing 87 of the 97 parliamentary seats, local media reported.

title: 2 Bangladesh-Origin US Nationals Deported From Mizoram Over Alleged Links With CHT Insurgents: Sources
content: Two Bangladesh-origin US nationals were arrested in Mizoram's Lengpui airport on Saturday and deported from the state capital Aizawl after it was learnt that they planned to meet militants of the KNA/F, top sources in the northeast state told NDTV.

title: Pahalgam Terror Attack Highlights:  Omar Abdullah Meets PM Modi Days After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Pahalgam Terrorist Attack Highlights: Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has called on Prime Minister Narendra Modi today to discuss the situation in the Union Territory, days after terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: "Knowingly Harbouring...": CRPF Constable Conceals Marriage To Pak Woman, Sacked
content: A constable, whose wife was about to be deported to Pakistan and got last-minute relief from the Jammu and Kashmir High Court, has now been sacked by the paramilitary force for concealing his marriage to a Pakistani national.

title: "Caste Census Congress' Brainchild, Rahul Gandhi Pitched It": DK Shivakumar
content: It was Rahul Gandhi who championed the caste count, which the Centre has announced will be part of the next census, Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar told NDTV.

title: 'Permission Was Granted': Sacked CRPF Trooper On Marriage To Pakistani Woman
content: Hours after being dismissed from service for "concealing" his marriage with a Pakistani woman, CRPF trooper Munir Ahmed on Saturday said he solemnized his marriage nearly a month after getting permission from the force's headquarters last year.

title: Manipur Marks 2nd Anniversary Of Ethnic Clashes With Mass Gatherings
content: A statewide shutdown and mass gatherings marked the second anniversary of the ethnic clashes between the Meitei and Kuki and Zomi tribes of Manipur on Saturday, amid demands for free and safe movement of all residents.

title: "Trade Should Not Be A Weapon": Warren Buffett Amid Trump's Tariff War
content: Influential billionaire investor Warren Buffett said Saturday that "trade should not be a weapon," in remarks clearly targeting US President Donald Trump's aggressive use of tariffs against countries around the world.

title: Teen Girl's Body Found Hanging From Tree In Delhi Park, Suicide Suspected
content: A teenage girl was found hanging from a tree in Japanese Park in Delhi's Rohini area on Saturday morning, an official said.

title: Married Man Throws Acid On Lover Days Before Her Wedding In UP: Cops
content: A married man and his accomplices on Saturday threw acid on his alleged girlfriend, enraged over her impending marriage to another person, police here said.
